content: new stream to continue the conversation on Service and Product catalog in FHIR.

Thanks Eric, for creating this stream.
Talking about IVD diagnostic service catalogs, and spinning your idea of building definitional resources as profiles to existing operational resources, I like it, provided we can work around elements currently mandatory, such as Specimen.subject, Observation.status (ObservationStatus VS required), DiagnosticRequest.stage, DiagnosticRequest.subject.

This is my one-page summary on IVD diagnostic service catalogs use case. LabTestCatalog_eDosToFHIR_Aug29.docx
Gives an idea of who it can help and how.
It also orientates on search parameters.
As discussed yesterday, the alternative to DataElement & ActivityDefinition is profiling existing business oriented resource types.
I'm reposting my notes from yesterday's OO on FHIR meeting a few links to diagrams and logical model
